programme.title: Burgers, Brew and 'Que

programme.title: Burgers, Brew and 'Que

programme.title: Carnival Eats
programme.desc: Noah Cappe heads to Charlotte, Mich. for the Eaton County Fair, where he takes a swing at the PB battered burger, then goes coco-nutty for the pina colada shrimp tacos.

programme.title: Carnival Eats
programme.desc: Noah Cappe's first stop is the Wayne County Fair in Richmond, Ind., where he takes a stroll with the Walking BBQ, feels the groove of the King with a bacon PB&J quesadilla, goes healthy-ish with a deep fried salad.

programme.title: Carnival Eats
programme.desc: Noah Cappe cruises up the west coast, starting at the Columbia County Fair in St. Helens, Ore. First up is a traditional Indian fry bread stuffed with some non-traditional ingredients, then Noah dives into the coastal fusion of the great Pacific pita.

programme.title: Carnival Eats
programme.desc: Noah Cappe starts at the Delaware State Fair, where he'll eat the very stately Delaware Dog, a hot dog loaded with scrapple. Then, he'll try to tackle the funnel cake-filled Frankenfunnel Burger and the octopus-loaded Octotaco.

programme.title: Carnival Eats
programme.desc: Host Noah Cappe looks east for inspiration as he explores Asian flavours on the fairgrounds. From classic foods like shrimp fried rice balls at the Pacific national exhibition and the spicy Kaprao burger.

programme.title: Carnival Eats
programme.desc: Noah Cappe heads to northern Indiana, where the Hoosiers in Valparaiso are doing things right at the Porter County Fair. The Super Ramen Dog combines two delicious foods Noah didn't know belonged together, the Elephant Ear Taco.

programme.title: Man v. Food
programme.desc: Casey Webb's search for the biggest and best in Santa Fe, New Mexico, starts with a sopapilla stuffed with carne asada. Then he takes on some game-changing ice cream flavored with the local delicacy, green chiles.

programme.title: Man v. Food
programme.desc: Casey Webb's tasty travels bring him to Manchester, New Hampshire, for an epic portion of barbecue that's served on a shovel at KC's Rib Shack. At local favourite Mr. Mac's Mac and Cheese, he only has eyes for their magnum opus.

programme.title: Man v. Food
programme.desc: Casey Webb ventures to beautiful Boise, Idaho, for a sushi and soup challenge so diabolically spicy, it goes by the name of Demon's Delight.

programme.title: Man v. Food
programme.desc: Casey travels to Grand Rapids, Michigan, where he takes on a five-pound tray loaded with chili dogs, French fries, beer-battered onion rings and a 20-ounce soda.

programme.title: Man v. Food
programme.desc: Armed with a serious love of food and years of experience in the restaurant business, Casey Webb travels the country in search of America's most delicious dishes and ultimate eating challenges.

programme.title: Man v. Food
programme.desc: Casey's sojourn of sustenance has had no shortage of sweets, and now it's time to celebrate the best of the best. We're counting down the most decadent desserts in Man vs. Food history and inducting them into our Hall of Fame.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: Athens is the birthplace of many culinary traditions, and Andrew explores the classics: from stuffed grape leaves and spanakopita to moussaka and real Greek yogurt, still made the way folks have done for generations.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: Florence, Italy lives up to its artistic reputation even in its food. Andrew Zimmern explores the classics like the rare Florentine steak, thick ribollita soup, the original cappuccino and the world famous frozen dessert, gelato.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: In the city of love, Andrew Zimmern explores the delicious delicacies of Paris, France; from the indulgent steak frites and the croque monsieur, to the baked croissant and baguette, to the sweet macaroons and savory crepes.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: London, England, is a multicultural melting pot, and Andrew Zimmern explores the dishes that have stayed the test of time: from the traditional Sunday roast and Yorkshire pudding to the classic pies 'n' mash and fish 'n' chips.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern reveals Tel Aviv's most iconic eats, from falafel to hummus to shawarma.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: Andrew unveils Albuquerque's desert gems, from enchiladas to nut rolls.

programme.title: The Zimmern List
programme.desc: Andrew heads to Charleston, SC, and his first order of business is paying a visit to the queen of soul food. Then, he chows down on Gullah cuisine, a favorite among locals, and indulges in fresh seafood.

programme.title: The Zimmern List
programme.desc: Andrew heads to Reno, NV, for a food scene that loves to entertain. He embraces Reno's small town pride as he savors homemade meatballs and ravioli, gets a taste of Basque culture and meets some forward-thinking chefs.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern explores the cuisine of Delhi, India's capital and home to roughly 24 million people.

programme.title: Cold Case Files

programme.desc: Tulsa's most vulnerable members find themselves potential victims of a possible spree killer. Detective Max Ryden does all he can to try and stop the murderer from upping their body count.

programme.desc: In Mobile, a man who turned his life around is gunned down in cold blood. Detectives need to know if his troubled past came back to haunt him.

programme.title: The American Game
programme.desc: As much as any other sport, the history of college football tells the history of American race relations. You can't appreciate the sport's complexities without knowing how long the road has been, and continues to be, towards equal rights.

programme.title: The American Game

programme.title: The American Game
programme.desc: Everything starts with the quality of the players that a school is able to recruit. Since college football's earliest days, recruiting has been one of the most critical and controversial aspects of the sport.

programme.title: The American Game
programme.desc: For generations, America was at least somewhat content to agree to often vehemently disagree. Controversies arose from the polls to computers to the creation of the BCS. At last, the College Football Playoff has offered a more decisive solution.

programme.desc: When a woman inherits a Christmas tree farm from her late grandmother, she decides the sensible thing to do is sell it. However, once she revisits the farm, she falls in love with the townspeople and the farm.

programme.title: Christmas in Homestead
programme.desc: A famous actress heads to a Christmas-obsessed town to film a movie, and is thrown for a loop when a romance brews between her and a local inn keeper, who's a single dad. As she gets a taste of small-town life, she discovers the true meaning of Christmas.

programme.title: Chateau Christmas
programme.desc: A world-famous pianist returns The Chateau at Christmas to spend the holiday with her family and rediscover her passion for music.

programme.title: Christmas Wishes and Mistletoe Kisses
programme.desc: A woman is hired to decorate an estate building a few weeks before Christmas. While there, she works to break down the wall between her and the business owner, all while keeping the holiday spirit alive.

programme.title: Snow Bride
programme.desc: A reporter pretends to be the girlfriend of the son of a famous politician to help him save face over Christmas. She becomes torn between exposing newsworthy scoops about the famous family and trusting that she's falling in love for real.

programme.title: A Timeless Christmas

programme.title: The Nine Lives of Christmas

programme.title: Sharing Christmas

programme.title: A Cookie Cutter Christmas

programme.title: A Royal Christmas
programme.desc: A woman is whisked away to Europe when her boyfriend reveals he's actually a prince.

programme.title: Let It Snow

programme.title: The Christmas Club
programme.desc: Two busy strangers are thrown together to help an elderly woman recover her lost savings. While working together, the magic of the season prevails, leading the couple to discover something they have been missing, love.

programme.title: Christmas Under the Stars
programme.desc: A man loses his job right before Christmas, so he takes a temporary job selling trees. While at work, he meets a woman and her son, who are dealing with the sudden loss of her father. The two get to talking, and out of their loss, love grows.

programme.title: One Royal Holiday
programme.desc: A woman offers stranded family a place to stay during a blizzard. Unbeknownst to her, they are members of a royal family. Despite their different backgrounds, the woman shows her guests what a small-town Christmas is all about.

programme.desc: A television producer is forced to work with the man who broke her heart on a country music Christmas special while being interrupted by Christmas spirits determined for her to revisit her past.

programme.title: Christmas Next Door

programme.title: With Love, Christmas

programme.title: Mingle All the Way

programme.title: Christmas Made to Order

programme.title: Cherished Memories: A Gift to Remember

programme.desc: Two long-time rival school teachers duke it out during the holidays in a bake-off. With both determined to win the prize, their competitiveness could jeopardize what matters most this Christmas season.

programme.desc: Chamo delivers a New York Note to the guys; it says that NY wants a man that is good with his hands. The remaining 9 guys will break up into 3 teams of 3 and build doghouses for NY's Chihuhua, Her Majesty. Some teams work together well but others fight.

programme.title: I Love New York
programme.desc: New York is down to her lucky 7 and wants to know which guys have skills on the court. She invites her friend Tamara Moore from the WNBA to put her men to the test and the best man wins a date with NY. One of the guys ends up in the hospital.

programme.title: I Love New York
programme.desc: The six guys gather in the living room when New York tells them that they will be hosting a party for her girls while she goes shopping. The guys excitement turns to terror when ten screaming 11-year-olds run in the front door, it's a princess party.

programme.title: I Love New York
programme.desc: New York decides to do a background check on the remaining five guys so she invites their ex-girlfriends to a day at the spa. While the guys sweat it out at the mansion, their ex's give NY and her mom all the dirt they want to know.

programme.title: I Love New York
programme.desc: New York wants to get to know the guys better so she takes them on two separate overnight double dates to Palm Springs. At the end of each night, she chooses one special guy to join her in her room for a nightcap.

programme.title: I Love New York
programme.desc: All three guys have met New York's mom, now it's her turn to meet theirs. The guys and their moms do their best to impress NY and Sister Patterson but they are tough ladies.

programme.title: I Love New York
programme.desc: After the last elimination, New York tells her final two men to pack their bags because they're going to Playa Car, Mexico for an exotic getaway. Mexico is beautiful but things quickly get ugly when the guys threaten to kill each other.

programme.title: I Love New York: Reunited
programme.desc: Tiffany Pollard is reuniting with exes from her hit dating show, I Love New York. With help from her mom, Tiffany and the men from her past will break down their relationships, relive the most viral moments, and give an update on where they are today.
